Entry.title: Entry
Entry.description: Represents a user-submitted form entry in Agriassist, stored in Firestore.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Entry entity.

userId.description: User ID of the user who submitted the form.  Empty string if user is not authenticated.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the form was submitted.

cropType.description: The predicted crop type from the AI model.

conditionDisease.description: The predicted health status or disease condition of the crop.

imageUrl.description: URL of the uploaded crop image stored in Cloud Storage.

predictionConfidence.description: The prediction confidence level of the AI model (0-1).

definition.description: Stores user-submitted form entries. Includes fields for userId, timestamp, cropType, conditionDisease, imageUrl, and predictionConfidence.

params.name: entryId
params.description: Unique identifier for the entry document.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to store user-submitted form entries in a secure and scalable manner. The core collection is `crop_data`. Each document in this collection represents a single form submission, identified by a unique ID. The structure ensures authorization independence by storing all necessary data within each entry document. Since authentication is optional, the `userId` field can be empty. All documents within the `crop_data` collection share the same security requirements, which simplifies the security rules. This structure supports listing all entries for a specific user, by filtering by `userId` (for authenticated users) and enables QAPs since rules are not filters.
